messages.content: I'm going to upload the application form and i want your help to fill it out by asking me progressively the questions, you ready?
I'm ready! Go ahead and upload the application form, and we'll get started on filling it out together.

i'm going to give you the whole application in a big jumble of text can you make a markdown version that i can download with all the long form content easy to fill in by giving it a heading and then some space to write?
Sure! Just paste the text of the application here, and I'll format it into a markdown document that will be easy for you to fill out.

Language: Version:
Inspira Uploadable Application Form
Version:
Warning: The United Nations is aware of various schemes being circulated via e-mail, regular mail and fax, falsely stating that they are issued by or
associated with the United Nations. Please note that the United Nations only accepts applications uploaded through the inspira online recruitment
system. Email applications will not be accepted.
Welcome!
This form is available to offer the flexibility of preparing an offline application for job openings posted in inspira.
You can complete your initial application using this form. Your data will be then stored in inspira and can be used
for any future applications.
Please note that the offline application template does not include accessibility features such as the ability to
function with a wide range of standard assistive technologies (e.g. screen readers and alternative keyboards). To
have full access to these accessibility features, please apply through the inspira online page and turn on the
"Accessibility" button.
Note: Complete this form using Adobe Acrobat Reader version 9.1 or above. Also make sure you have the latest
version of this form since only the latest version can be uploaded in inspira.
To apply for job openings using this form, please follow the steps shown below:
1. Complete this form and save it to your computer with the existing file name. Complete the form ensuring
that you fill out all required sections which are marked with asterisk (*). Make sure to fill out all Work
Experience and Education Details
2. Log into inspira (https://inspira.un.org)
3. It is very important that you first ensure that your contact information (including your e-mail address and
phone number) is current and correct. If we cannot reach you at the e-mail or phone number provided,
you may not be considered further for the job opening to which you are applying. If you need to update
your contact information, please do it online in inspira by clicking on the “My Profile” tab in your inspira
applicant activity center (home page).
4. After updating your profile, go back to your inspira applicant activity center. Using the inspira job search
tool, locate and open the required job opening and then click on “Apply Now”.
5. Under the "Welcome" section, select the "Load from File" option, then upload your completed Offline
Application Template form.
6. Once the template has been uploaded successfully, click on "Next".
7. Answer the Job Requirements Questions specific to the job opening and validate each section of your
application.
8. Under the “Other information” tab, upload relevant file(s) here (e.g., two latest performance management
documents for UN staff). For applications to locally recruited staff positions in the General Service or
related categories, please upload one or more documents (e.g., passport, work permit) that indicate your
right to work in the duty station you are applying to.
9. When you are ready to submit your application, click on the “Review/Submit” tab and review all sections.
10. Click on “Submit Application”. Immediately after submitting your application, its status on the “My
Application” page should be “Applied”.
Language: Version:
Inspira Uploadable Application Form
Version:
Warning: The United Nations is aware of various schemes being circulated via e-mail, regular mail and fax, falsely stating that they are issued by or
associated with the United Nations. Please note that the United Nations only accepts applications uploaded through the inspira online recruitment
system. Email applications will not be accepted.
Education
Job openings at the United Nations stipulate education requirements which are equivalent to a high school diploma, first-level
university degree (i.e. bachelor's degree, or equivalent) or advanced university degree (i.e. master's and doctorate degree or
equivalent). Please list the academic qualifications you have and attach a copy of each completed diploma and degree in the "Other
Information" page, “Attachments” section.
Academic qualifications must be conferred by institutions which are accredited to issue them by the competent authority in the country
where the issuing institutions are based. Applicants are responsible for ensuring that the qualifications listed in this application are
properly accredited at the time of issuance.
Please note that the name of your school/university may not be found on this form. For a complete list of educational institutions, you
can check again in the system after uploading this form back into inspira. In case a university or degree can still not be found, please
follow guidance in chapter 3 of the Applicant guide available on the UN Careers Portal.
The equivalency of all academic qualifications you list in your application may be subject to further determination as and when
deemed appropriate during the selection process.
You do not need to enter any training/learning activities nor certificates or short-term diplomas you may have completed in this
section. You may be asked specific questions related to those areas under the "Job Requirements" page, as necessary in relation to
this position.
Education Details
School Degree/diploma From To Degree/Diploma
Obtained
Degree/Diploma
Conferral Date
Languages
Please list all languages that you know including your mother tongue, and indicate your proficiency level from the dropdown list
provided in the four specified areas of “Reading”, “Speaking”, “Understanding” and “Writing”. To be considered fluent in a language,
your proficiency level in all four specified areas must be “Fluent”. To be considered to have knowledge in a language, your proficiency
level in at least two out of the four specified areas must be “Confident” or “Fluent”.
Your application will be rejected if you fail to indicate that you meet the requisite proficiency level for a language in which fluency or
knowledge is required for this job opening. You may be considered not suitable if you fail to indicate that you meet the requisite
proficiency level for a language in which fluency or knowledge is desirable for this job opening.
Languages Reading
Proficiency
Speaking
Proficiency
Understanding
Proficiency
Writing
Proficiency
How Acquired? Mother
Tongue
Pass
LPELanguage: Version:
Inspira Uploadable Application Form
Version:
Warning: The United Nations is aware of various schemes being circulated via e-mail, regular mail and fax, falsely stating that they are issued by or
associated with the United Nations. Please note that the United Nations only accepts applications uploaded through the inspira online recruitment
system. Email applications will not be accepted.
Work Experience
Please tell us about your current and previous work experience by clicking on “Add Work Experience,” and then entering your
employment details and the description of duties.
Please note that the United Nations system and related organizations, their agents and employees may contact your employers and
supervisors for verification of employment and reference during the staff selection process. During the application, you may indicate
that you do not wish us to contact your current employer and supervisor during the staff selection process. If you are selected for this
job opening at the conclusion of the staff selection process, verification from your current employer and supervisor will be mandatory.
Work Experience
Employer Job Title From To
* Employment status and history in the UN system and related organisations:
Please tell us about your employment status and history in the UN system or related organisations.
I have never worked in the United Nations system or related organizations.
I'm currently working in the United Nations system or related organizations.
I have previously worked in the United Nations system or related organizations.
References
Please list at least three professional references apart from supervisors below. You may include professors, thesis advisors, mentors,
colleagues, peers, team members, former supervisees, collaborators, clients, stakeholders in your work, or other persons with whom
you have had professional relationships. Applicants are encouraged to list a variety of different types of references. Applicants with
managerial experience are encouraged to list past direct supervisees who could provide a perspective on their role as a manager.
Please do not list personal references such as family and friends.
References other than supervisors
Reference Title EmployerLanguage: Version:
Inspira Uploadable Application Form
Version:
Warning: The United Nations is aware of various schemes being circulated via e-mail, regular mail and fax, falsely stating that they are issued by or
associated with the United Nations. Please note that the United Nations only accepts applications uploaded through the inspira online recruitment
system. Email applications will not be accepted.
Motivation Statement
Please explain what motivates you to apply for this position. You may also use this space to tell us about anything else that is not
already in your application that makes you a good fit for this position.

[text limit 2,000 characters incl. spaces]
* Have you ever committed, been convicted of, or prosecuted for, any criminal offence? Have you ever been
involved, by act or omission, in the commission of any violation of international human rights law or international
humanitarian law?
Yes No
Have you ever committed, been investigated for, been prosecuted for, had a finding against you for, or been
convicted of an offence for, engaging in sexual exploitation and/or abuse?
Yes No
Language: Version:
The General Assembly through Resolution - A/RES/70/114 - requires that the UN Secretariat ensures that all UN
officials are properly vetted for any prior misconduct.
For serving United Nations Secretariat staff members:
* Have you received a disciplinary measure or administrative measure following a disciplinary process? If
the answer is "yes,” please provide details.
Yes No N/A
For all candidates other than serving Secretariat staff members:
* Have you been the subject of a workplace disciplinary process or other similar process or a workplace
investigation or similar process of which you are aware? If the answer is "yes," please provide the details
and provide information about any sanction or measure taken.
Yes No N/A
* Are you a successful candidate of the National Competitive Recruitment Examination (NCRE) or the competitive
examination for recruitment to the Professional category of staff members from other categories (G-to-P), or the
United Nations Young Professionals Programme examination (YPP)?
Yes No
Personal Information
Do you consider yourself to have a disability? Prefer Not to Answer Yes No
The purpose of the questions on disability is to help understand the extent to which the UN Secretariat is meeting its commitments to become an
employer of choice for people with disabilities under the United Nations Disability Inclusion Policy. For more details, Click Here .

Here's the markdown version of your application form, formatted with headings and spaces for easy filling. I will provide this as a downloadable file:

```markdown
# Inspira Uploadable Application Form

## Version Information

Language:  
Version:  

## Warning

The United Nations is aware of various schemes being circulated via e-mail, regular mail, and fax, falsely stating that they are issued by or associated with the United Nations. Please note that the United Nations only accepts applications uploaded through the inspira online recruitment system. Email applications will not be accepted.

## Welcome

This form is available to offer the flexibility of preparing an offline application for job openings posted in inspira. You can complete your initial application using this form. Your data will then be stored in inspira and can be used for any future applications.

### Accessibility Notice

Please note that the offline application template does not include accessibility features such as the ability to function with a wide range of standard assistive technologies (e.g., screen readers and alternative keyboards). To have full access to these accessibility features, please apply through the inspira online page and turn on the "Accessibility" button.

### Application Instructions

1. Complete this form and save it to your computer with the existing file name. Complete the form ensuring that you fill out all required sections which are marked with an asterisk (*). Make sure to fill out all Work Experience and Education Details.
2. Log into inspira ([https://inspira.un.org](https://inspira.un.org)).
3. It is very important that you first ensure that your contact information (including your e-mail address and phone number) is current and correct. Update your contact information online in inspira by clicking on the “My Profile” tab in your inspira applicant activity center (home page).
4. After updating your profile, go back to your inspira applicant activity center. Using the inspira job search tool, locate and open the required job opening and then click on “Apply Now”.
5. Under the "Welcome" section, select the "Load from File" option, then upload your completed Offline Application Template form.
6. Once the template has been uploaded successfully, click on "Next".
7. Answer the Job Requirements Questions specific to the job opening and validate each section of your application.
8. Under the “Other information” tab, upload relevant file(s) here (e.g., two latest performance management documents for UN staff). For applications to locally recruited staff positions in the General Service or related categories, please upload one or more documents (e.g., passport, work permit) that indicate your right to work in the duty station you are applying to.
9. When you are ready to submit your application, click on the “Review/Submit” tab and review all sections.
10. Click on “Submit Application”. Immediately after submitting your application, its status on the “My Application” page should be “Applied”.

## Education

### Academic Qualifications

List the academic qualifications you have and attach a copy of each completed diploma and degree in the "Other Information" page, “Attachments” section.

#### Education Details

- School:  
- Degree/Diploma Obtained:  
- From:  
- To:  
- Degree/Diploma Conferral Date:  

## Languages

List all languages that you know including your mother tongue, and indicate your proficiency level from the dropdown list provided in the four specified areas of “Reading”, “Speaking”, “Understanding”, and “Writing”.

### Language Proficiency

- Language:  
- Reading Proficiency:  
- Speaking Proficiency:  
- Understanding Proficiency:  
- Writing Proficiency:  
- How Acquired?  
- Mother Tongue:  
- Pass LPE:  

## Work Experience

Tell us about your current and previous work experience by clicking on “Add Work Experience,” and then entering your employment details and the description of duties.

### Employment Details

- Employer:  
- Job Title:  
- From:  
- To:  

## References

List at least three professional references apart from supervisors below.

### Reference Details

- Reference Title:  
- Employer:  

## Motivation Statement

Please explain what motivates you to apply for this position. You may also use this space to tell us about anything else that is not already in your application that makes you a good fit for this position.

- [text limit 2,000 characters incl. spaces]

## Legal Declarations

### Have you ever committed, been convicted of, or prosecuted for, any criminal offence?

- Yes  
- No  

### Have you ever been involved in any violation of international human rights law or international humanitarian law?

- Yes  
- No  

### For UN Staff

* Have you received a disciplinary measure or administrative measure following a disciplinary process?

- Yes  
- No  
- N/A  

## Personal Information

### Do you consider yourself to have a disability?

- Prefer Not to Answer  
- Yes  
- No  
```
